N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 575.2 - Measuring distances

State Regulations
(a) All
distances specified in the shoreline restrictions are measured horizontally. Shoreline lot widths are measured along the shoreline as it winds and turns at
the mean high water mark. (b) Building setback restrictions are measured along the shortest line between any
point of the structure and any point on the mean high water mark. (c) Wastewater treatment system setbacks are
measured along the shortest line between any point of the seepage pit, drainage
field or other leaching facility and any point on the mean high water
mark. (d) In the case of the Great

Sacandaga Lake, mean high water mark
shall mean the spillway
elevation contour of 771 feet above mean sea level. Notes
